Dates for future releases of Hippo CMS
Release Schedule
Hippo works with a monthly development cycle. We believe in the Release Early, Release Often paradigm from the Linux community, and use the SCRUM development methodology to iteratively build our software. We have 4 scheduled releases per year. A release is a version for which Hippo offers paid support services. See http://www.onehippo.com/en/support for more information.
Here's the Roadmap outine for 2009. This is a list of how we intent to roll out functionalities, even though some changes may occur as priorities shift.
Scheduled date Release Feature Goals
December, 2008 Hippo CMS v7.0 (r2.02.xx) Folder structure, Template editor, Workflow, Internationalization (i18n), AJAX support, Search, Multi-document tabs, Locking, Authorizations, Plugin architecture, Versioning, Clustering, Scheduled publication, User management, Image and asset galleries
March, 2009 Hippo CMS v7.1 (r2.05.xx) All standard Hippo CMS 6 features, Faceted browsing, Tagging, Split pane versioning, Migration path CMS 6 to CMS 7, Forms, Metadata extraction (from Word, PDF, etc), Batch workflow actions, HST-2 Configuration editor
June, 2009 Hippo CMS v7.2 (r2.08.xx) Hippo CMS 6 migration tools, Reporting, Translations workflow
September, 2009 Hippo CMS v7.3 (r2.11.xx) DMS, BPM, Metadata suggestor, collections, full-repository archiving
December, 2009 Hippo CMS v7.4 (r2.14.xx) TBD
v7.0 (December 2008)
Goal: deliver all basic CMS functionalities, production ready
Feature Description
Folder structure Information architect creates a free folder structure to contain documents. Every document has one position in the folder tree.
Template editor Developer creates and edits the CMS editing templates using the Template Editor in the CMS.
Workflow Standard Reviewed Actions workflow implemented (author / editor, two step process).
Internationalization (i18n) All text in the CMS user interface is available in at least two languages: English and Dutch.
AJAX support Uses AJAX to load parts of the user interface.
Auto-save / document recovery AJAX document editor continuously saves changes in the user's draft version. No loss of data when accidentally navigating away from the CMS.
Search Full-text search as an AJAX dropdown.
Multi-document tabs User can have multiple multiple documents open as tabs.
Locking When someone edits a document, it is locked for others.
Authorizations Restrictions can be set on groups and users, based on properties.
Plugin architecture CMS can be extended by adding plugins, to be downloaded from the Hippo Forge.
Versioning Per publication, a version is stored. Using a dropdown, the user can see the contents of older versions.
Clustering Repository runs in a clustered environment.
Scheduled publication Workflow requests can be set to a time and date.
User management Users, groups and domains can be edited.
Image and asset galleries Support for galleries that contain images, binary files (PDF, DOC, etc). Thumbnails.
LDAP support Support for external authorization repositories based on LDAP (Active Directory, OpenLDAP).
Cross browser support Support for Internet Explorer 6, 7 and Firefox 3
v7.1 (March 2009)
Goal: All CMS 6 functionalities + faceted functionalities
Feature Description
All standard Hippo CMS 6 features All functionalities that are included in the standard download of Hippo CMS 6 are supported out of the box.
Word import
Faceted browsing Users can create their own views on content, and can navigate and operate the CMS using this interface.
Tagging Tagging support for all documents and gallery items.
Split pane versioning Versions can be viewed side by side
Migration path CMS 6 to CMS 7 Migration path for migrating CMS 6 projects to CMS 7.
Forms Form support. Creating forms from within the CMS, and presentation and validation support from the HST
Separated deployment The possibility to deploy the CMS and Repository on different machines.
Metadata extraction (from Word, PDF, etc) Automated meta data extraction from assets.
Batch workflow actions Initiate workflow steps on multiple documents at once.
HST-2 Configuration editor Configuration of the Hippo Site Toolkit from within the CMS.
Content OTAP Automated migration of content sets from Development, to Test, to Acceptance and to Production repositories.
Customer skinning Support customer skinning of CSS and plugins.
v7.2 (June 2009)
Feature Description
Metadata / tag suggestors Guiding the user in the metada generation process. Facilitate tagging of large sets of content.
User profiles Different UI configurations for different user profiles. Casual contributor versus advanced editor.
Hot deployable plugins OSGi support.
Knowledge driven workflow Flexible worfklow configuration based on user profiles and content metadata.
Website templating The possibility to edit Freemarker or JSP templates from within the CMS.
Task management Tasks and workflow items spawning multiple documents, or broader.
CMIS support REST and CMIS interfaces for developers.
Customizable help Functionality to change the help texts for a specific implementation.
Personalized reporting "My recent documents", "My Tasks", etc
Advanced Search Searching on metadata, and storing searches as faceted views.
v7.3 (September 2009)
Feature Description
DMS functionality Document management capabilities, network share.
External BPM layer Support for business process management integration.
OpenOffice integration Native support for OpenOffice documents in the DMS subsystem.
Repository-wide content tagging and labeling Label a "Christmas" edition of your website and schedule it for publication.
Archiver View the contents of the entire repository on a certain date.
Visitor generated metadata management Use visitor behavior and feedback for tagging documents in the repository, in a controlled manner.
Metadata suggestor Suggesting the CMS user what possible metadata could be added to the current document, based on the user's behavior in the CMS itself.
Collections Collections functionality: hand-picked, search or folder selection. Collections can be used for navigation. Collections have workflow.
